data.title: Autoindent not working properly
data.body:
Version: 0.192.0
## Problem

1) `autoindent` fails to indent parameter lists. Note: If I hit enter after `fake_function(`, `param=` would be indented 3x -- class > def > foo.

``` python
class Bar(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_indentation(self):
        foo = fake_function(param='hello',
        second_param='world', # should have indented this line
        ) # and this one, too
```

After saving, `atom-beautify` correctly indents the parameters

``` python
class Bar(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_indentation(self):
        foo = fake_function(param='hello',
                            second_param='world', # fixed!
                            ) # me, too!
```

2) But now, `autoindent` fails to reset indentation back to the beginning of the line

``` python
        [...]
        foo = fake_function(param='hello',
                            second_param='world',
                            )

                            bar = 'after_continuing typing' # ach!!
```

Unfortunately `atom-beautify` doesn't quite fix this ever time.

``` python
        foo = fake_function(param='hello',
                            second_param='world',
                            )
            bar = 'after_continuing typing'
```
## Note

I recently updated atom-beautify as an attempt to help resolve the issue, but I am now getting errors there. The problems mentioned above still exist, but I will update if anything changes.
## Update

Here's some testing in 
#### Sublime3:

``` python

def testing_indentation_in_sublime(some_var):
    first_line = "works"
    second_test = func_indentation(multiple_param,
        auto_indents,
        still_here,
        ) # parenthesis auto matched when typed!

    third_test = alt_indentation(
        looks_just_like above,
        which_was_wrong,
        but_this_works,
        )

        fourth_line = existing_indentation('retry last pasting',
                                       'broken') 
        and_indent_is_kept

    fifth_line = backspace_only_does_one_space('testing existing indent',
                                               'testing')
    indentation = "working!!"

    if check_nested_indent is not None:
        basic_indent = True
    elif check_indent:
        also_works = True
        if nested:
            so_far = so_good
        else:
            also_good = True
        else:
            uh_oh = 'is this really that hard?'

    return end_of_function

    def still_indented():
        '''sigh.'''
        indentation = 'not perfect here, either (but way better)'
```
#### Eclipse

``` python
def indent_test_eclipse(some_var):
    first_line = 'smoke test'
    second_test = func_with_param(style_one,
                                  hey_it_works,
                                  )
    back_to_the_beginning = 'holy crap.'
    third_test = func_with_alt_style(
                                     hrmmm,
                                     )

    if nested_indent is not None:
        basic_indent = True
    elif reindents_on_space_not_colon:
        still_okay = True
        if nested:
            so_far = so_good
        else:
            also_good = True
        else:
            must_be_difficult = True

    return end_of_function

def correctly_indents_after_return():
    '''Woo hoo'''

    return True
```

data.title: atom filename:0 bug
data.body:
Hi,
on atom 0.196 and mac os 10.9.3

For a file "file.rb", that opens fine with 

> atom file.rb:10

When i leave out the 10, so

> atom file.rb:

atom opens a new file with that filename (including the :)
The same happens when i put a 0 (which never really happens to me, but was the easier subject)

This happens for me when i click in iterm2 , as item always adds the ":" but not always supplies a number.

For sane usage of filenames one could just ignore the trailing ":"

data.title: Atom Helper stack overflow when editing/opening a Python file

2. ...

**System**: Microsoft Windows 8.1 Pro
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

```

Error: spawn uncrustify ENOENT
  at exports._errnoException (util.js:734:11)
  at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1035:32)
  at child_process.js:1127:20
  at process._tickCallback (node.js:357:13)

```

data.title: Mini editors highlight injected grammars
data.body:
When typing in a mini editor, any grammars that inject into `text.plain` (for example `language-todo`) are highlighted. This is a bit weird, I'd expect no highlighting at all in mini editors.

![screen shot 2015-05-05 at 12 53 30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1759837/7472014/de26dcc4-f325-11e4-9362-c522c758ad5a.png)

Maybe mini editors should use some other scope to prevent this.

data.title: Focus of atom after opening file (Windows 7)
data.body:
Windows 7, atom already opened with the window in the background. 
When I open a file via the explorer, the symbol in the task bar is blinking but atom doesn't come to the front.
Is this a wanted behavior? 

(I couldn't find any existing issue. If this is the case, please let me know)

data.title: Add TextEditorElement::isCursorOnScreen()
data.body:
This adds the method `::isCursorOnScreen()` to `TextEditorElement`, which makes it a lot easier to determine whether or not a cursor is visible on screen without having to do the rows comparison yourself. This is especially handy for testing, but could certainly have other uses for package authors.

/cc @atom/feedback @nathansobo

data.title: Add Language-PowerShell to Atom Core?
data.body:
I often use Atom to work with PowerShell files. It would be great if the Language-PoweShell package could be shipped with Atom core.

https://atom.io/packages/language-powershell

I understand a line has to be drawn somewhere, but I wanted to ask anyway to see if it was practical.

The main reason I would like it to be in core, is I sometimes want to edit them on servers, where setting  up apm is painful (authenticated proxies etc.) and not worth the hassle.

Thanks in advance :smile:

data.title: Default CSS for `<progress>` element causes CPU to spike.
data.body:
This is on OS X, version 10.10.3 (Yosemite).

As shown in the animated GIF, enabling the following CSS style (which is present for `<progress>` elements) causes the CPU usage to spike:

``` css
-webkit-animation: animate-stripes 5s linear infinite;
```

From the Chrome profiling tools, you can see that all of the `<progress>` elements are being redrawn continuously while this CSS is being applied. Once it is removed, the CPU usage goes back down to zero and the redraw ends.

Outright removing this style only affects the display of indeterminate progress bars, as they appear to be designed to have a "barber poll" animation.

Something should be done so that package developers who introduce the use of a `<progress>` element do not inadvertently burn CPU.

![progress-causes-cpu-spike](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/655869/7463670/3f5f18d2-f270-11e4-8d12-886ab9b90829.gif)

data.title: Normalize package.json
data.body:
In an previously merged PR #6582 we just normalized the repository url. Here we normalize the entire `package.json` in the same way that npm does. 

TODO:
- [x] Fix Atom bundled packages with bad package data in order for this to go :green_apple: 

Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6601

data.title: Atom window can get stuck in "dev mode"
data.body:
- Atom will now restore your previous window state on restart.
- The serialization of the Atom window includes the "dev mode" flag.
- When you create a new window the "dev mode" flag is taken from any existing window. 

Together these things can have the effect of locking a user who doesn't know what's happening into dev mode.

https://discuss.atom.io/t/tip-how-to-stop-atom-from-always-opening-in-dev-mode/16576

data.title: apm fails on CentOS 7 (rpm) due to compiled against too new libstdc++
data.body:
apm fails on CentoOS 7 insalled from rpm with:

```
/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/node_modules/asar-require/node_modules/asar/node_modules/chromium-pickle/node_modules/bindings/bindings.js:83
        throw e
              ^
Error: /lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.20' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/node_modules/asar-require/node_modules/asar/node_modules/chromium-pickle/build/Release/pickle.node)
```

Which is due to compiling against a newer version of libstdc++ than is available in CentOS 7.

data.title: Feature request: Option for max file-size for syntax highlighting
data.body:
Hello!

I am a web developer so I sometimes need to handle concatinated files within my editor. This often locks atom from a few seconds to up to a minute, which is pretty hard on my workflow. Would it be possible for you guys to add an option for max-file size for syntax highlighting?

Problem files are often concatinated JS/CSS. Try [pasting this into Atom](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/misoproject/dataset/master/dist/miso.ds.deps.min.0.4.1.js). If you paste into new tab with no syntax highlighting it's fine. When you try to save as JS it locks up the editor.

Thanks!

data.title: Atom crashes when I open large files
data.body:
Hello,

the only thing keeping me away from atom is the fact that it's crashing everytime I try to open a large file, jquery.min.js for example. In comparision to sublime, this is pretty bad because when atom doesn't crash, it takes up to 10 seconds to load the syntax highlighter.

Is there an issue similar to this or is this already tracked?

I'm using OSX Yosemite and Windows 8.1

data.title: Allow 0 to be passed as initialLine when opening files via command line
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1743 which was reopened due to this observation:

> This doesn't quite work yet. When opening a file to line 0, Atom will just try to open a file called "filename.txt:0" rather than just defaulting to the top of the file.

I think it's worth supporting this edge case where we'd normally expect the user to specify "1" as the initial line, not "0".

cc @kevinsawicki

data.title: The application Atom has closed unexpectedly
data.body:
While Atom runs following window popup, but atom will still run without any performance issues. Just wondering why and where it came from.

![screenshot from 2015-05-04 13 38 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1900106/7452868/368cb01e-f263-11e4-9b91-af0c2f2237db.png)
![screenshot from 2015-05-04 13 38 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1900106/7452873/3bf9f3a4-f263-11e4-8fd6-9d9427402b5e.png)

I noticed this issue since ASAR is used in atom, maybe related.

data.title: Install task leads to undefined symbol: node_module_register
data.body:
After building Atom using

```
script/clean && script/build
```

I usually install Atom using

```
sudo script/grunt install
```

Which obviously succeeds, but logs a worrying error:

```
Loading "index.js" tasks...ERROR
>> Error: /mnt/vmstor/git/atom/build/node_modules/grunt-atom-shell-installer/node_modules/asar/node_modules/chromium-pickle/build/Release/pickle.node: undefined symbol: node_module_register

Running "install" task
Done, without errors.
```

Is there anything that can be done about this?
How can I be sure that my installation is not corrupted/incomplete in the end?

See also https://gist.github.com/xasx/91cde029a06c3f4bc4f3

data.title: zh_CN.utf8 cannot show
data.body:
hi admin
i am a new atom user, i use atom as a node/less editor.
My system $LANG=zh_CN.UTF-8
i have set the file encoding and atom perferences encoding to utf8.
when i write an html test file(include chinese charactors), the atom pane show a square, but in the browser is right.
I guess maybe atom lack fonts to show chinese charactors.
thank you for your help!

data.title: I save the file, but the view table is tips I did not save. 保存文件之后table上依然提示处于未保存的状态。
data.body:
My atom is 0.196.0,openSUSE13.2 & Gnome 3.14.2.

I save file  use `CTRL + S`.but the view table is tips the file is not save.

data.title: Error while loading shared libraries: libchromiumcontent.so
data.body:
The 0.196.0 release does not run on Linux 3.16.7.9-1-MANJARO when built from source using the atom-editor package from AUR.

Install runs without errors but when trying to open atom I get:
`/usr/share/atom/atom: error while loading shared libraries: libchromiumcontent.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`

Rolling back to 0.194.0 saved my day.

data.title: Add commands to move selections left and right by one column
data.body:
_See https://discuss.atom.io/t/shift-selection-by-column/16545?u=mnquintana for more background_

![screencap1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/823545/7448891/7c64c1ea-f1f4-11e4-94bf-dfbaab1a5ee6.gif)

This adds the column-equivalent of `TextEditor::moveLineUp()` and `TextEditor::moveLineDown()` - instead of moving a line up or down, these commands move any active selections left or right by one column. This is especially useful if you're refactoring / generally trying to clean up your code.

TODO:
- [x] Add keybindings for Linux and Windows (anyone have any suggestions for good keybindings for this?)
- [x] Consider renaming commands? (Is Move Selection Left / Right too vague?)
- [x] Fix case when moving multiple one-line selections to either the beginning or end of the line

Shoutout to @lee-dohm for helping with the implementation :wave: 

/cc @atom/feedback

data.title: Load packages on-demand (using scopes)
data.body:
I got the idea from reading through #6619 

---

The idea would be to have a way for package authors to scope their package loading and activation to a specific language scope. For instance, we don't need the `python-isort` package loading if I've never opened a python file.

data.title: Editing .gitignore doesn't re-color relevant files
data.body:
I added a makefile which was muted in the menu on the left because my `/gitignore` contained makefile. 

I removed the makefile line but the makefile tab wasn't updated instantly. 

I don't really know if this is a bug or not but I thought I'd report it just in case. It would be a cool feature to have the list updated everytime an edit is made to the `.gitignore`

data.title: fakeSetInterval doesn't work as expected if advanceClock is n times larger than interval.
open file with line number from command-line works inconsistent
data.body:
On os x 10.9 and atom 0.196

With open project-folder A and subfolder B and file c.rb
Clicking in iterm on c.rb (or running "atom B/c.rb ) will open the file in the project.
Also running atom B/c.rb:10 will open the file and go to line 10
Clicking on a stacktrace along the line of /My/home/dir/A/B/c.rb will open the file in the project, good
Just clicking /My/home/dir/A/B/c.rb:10 will open a new window with directory B and open file c.rb.
   It will jump to the line, but it has opened the undesired new window.

If someone points me to the code where this happens i can probably fix it myself. Probably just a copy/paste error where a common function would create consistency.

PS: related but not the same as issue #2745
PPS: Nice tool, a general thanks.
